intro: Gynopleura humilis, commonly known as the low gynopleura, is a small flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant features slender, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Its leaves are often lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gynopleura humilis is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
